title: Firewall Management Using PowerShell Script
description: Automating firewall management on local and remote machines using PowerShell .
objective: Create a PowerShell script that detects whether Windows Firewall is enabled on local or remote machines, enables it if disabled and confirms the firewall state.
steps: Configured VirtualBox VMs with Host-Only networking
Verified connectivity using ping and assign valid IP addresses
Run winrm quickconfig on each VM to configure WinRM service, listener and firewall rules
Changed network profile to Private to allow WinRM firewall exceptions
Enabled PowerShell Remoting on VMs using Enable-PSRemoting -Force
Started WinRM service and verify listener with Test-WsMan localhost
Configured TrustedHosts on host to include VM IPs
Tested remote connectivity with Invoke-Command and Get-Credential
Checked firewall status using 'Get-NetFirewallProfile' or 'netsh advfirewall show allprofiles'
Disabled firewall in one virtual machine using 'Set-NetFirewallProfile -Profile Domain, Private,Public -Enabled False' or 'netsh advfirewall set allprofiles state on'  to create a vulnerable machine
Automatically checked and enabled firewall if disabled using firewall_check.ps1 script
results: Successfully checked and enabled firewall on host machine and connected to remote machines using PowerShell Remoting, detected firewall status accurately and enabled firewall where needed

challenges.problem: WinRM firewall exception failed because the network profile on VM was Public
